attributes.action: Bring back levels for assessment and stop labelling our children as failures.
attributes.background: Children who don't meet the expected standard for their year group are being assessed as emerging and not 'Year _ ready'. Essentially we are telling them they have failed! Children need encouragement not labelling in this way. Levels mean that progress can easily be seen year on year.
attributes.additional_details: A whole generation of our children risk being labelled failures by the system that replaced levels. Previously a child and their parents would easily see progress during a school year by looking at their levels. Currently they are labelled as 'emerging', 'expected' or 'exceeding' and a child who is emerging is then described as not being ready for the next year group that they move in to. If our children are to achieve their true potential, we need to stop labelling them as failures!

attributes.action: Put pressure on Asian governments to stop the inhumane act of shark finning.
attributes.background: Shark numbers are declining due to shark finning - this is when a live shark is taken out of the ocean to have its fin cut off and then thrown back into the water. A shark needs its fin to swim and ultimately to survive. Without it the shark soon dies as it can no longer fend for itself.
attributes.additional_details: Each year an estimated 100-200 million sharks are caught for their fins, which often go into the Asian delicacy 'fin soup'. Sharks have been populating our oceans since before the dinosaurs and we can't lose them now. Sharks also play a crucial role in the ecosystem of the ocean by eating sick and dead animals and keeping the seas healthy. By saving sharks we save the oceans and the planet. Shark finning has no place in our modern world and must stop before we lose this ancient species forever.

attributes.action: Ensure there are dedicated disability wards for over 18s in hospitals
attributes.background: Our beautiful disabled daughter/Sister age 26 died of Pneumonia and we think the care of the ward could of been a lot better if there was a dedicated ward with 1 to 1 care and trained disability nurses!

attributes.action: Disability football should get more recognition
attributes.background: I Strongly Believe That Disability Football Should be Recognized more as a normal thing in society and that our government should support it more by supplying more funding and more publicity,
attributes.additional_details: Football can play a key role in any persons development let alone a disabled persons development, It can help them get Independence, socialize more and develop fine motor skills. Most football clubs run Disability football and it should get recognize more just like main stream football.

attributes.action: Honour our Queen by minting coins in real silver
attributes.background: Being a metal detectorist my friends and I find so many beautiful ancient coins that have stood up to being buried for centuries.  The coins we have now would have all rotted away of a similar period, let's honour our Queen by minting a few nice silver coins.
attributes.additional_details: Take a look at the Spinks coin book and you can see many examples of the beautiful coins our Monarchy once had minted in their name. For me to give examples I would need to be able to upload examples of Silver Hammered coins or the Silver Milled ones of more recent times.

attributes.action: Reject any Brexit terms that exclude the UK from the Common Market
attributes.background: This petition requires that before invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty, HM Government must ensure that, following Brexit, British citizens and firms will continue to have full, unprejudiced access to the European Economic Area.

attributes.action: Give all British expats and EU citizens living long-term in UK vote on EU.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum Act of 2015 disqualified many people who vote in local or general elections from voting on EU membership. We ask for a reform of the Act, to give franchise on EU membership to all British expats, and to EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years.
attributes.additional_details:
Commonwealth citizens residing in the UK could vote on EU membership on 23rd June 2016, whilst expats living abroad for more than fifteen years, and EU citizens living in Britain, could not. This disfavours individuals who have fully invested in the opportunities granted by Britainâ€™s long-term membership of the EU. We believe the Act goes against EU rights of free movement and the constitutional, common law of Britain.
We ask for another Act to be passed to allow a new Referendum in which all expats, and EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years, may vote. If we are to leave or remain in the EU, it must be a lawful decision, reflecting the wishes of our entire society.

attributes.action: Call a referendum so London can decide to be part of the UK or remain in the EU.
attributes.background:
London, as defined by all postal codes with a LONDON prefix, voted by overwhelming majority in the recent European referendum to remain part of the EU.  

We, the undersigned, believe that London should be allowed to decide its own future as separate from the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
London and its population has stronger ties to Europe than it does to England.  e.g. our dependence on financial services.

London voted by a similar margin in favour of Remain as Scotland.  By the same right that Scotland has to now decide its future, so does London. 

Our population is significantly more European and culturally diverse than the rest of the UK.

London gives more to the UK in tax revenue than the UK gives to London.  We would be stronger if financially independent.

attributes.action: Create a memorial or name a room within the Palace of Westminster after Jo Cox
attributes.background: Jo Cox MP was a Member of Parliament who dedicated the past year to her community and often fought for more things for Young people. In the memory of her life I propose that the Palace of Westminster name an area, room or dedicate a memorial to her life in her memory.

attributes.action: Introduce a social awareness lesson within the curriculum.
attributes.background: Bullying and discrimination within schools needs to be stopped. Let's introduce a social awareness lesson to allow youngsters the freedom of speech and allow them to talk about problems open and freely. Educate our youngsters the benefits of talking about problems and acceptance of other people.
attributes.additional_details: By educating youngsters about everyone is different and copes with things in different ways this will allow them to understand others behaviours and attitudes in situations. Mental health is vital within youngsters and allowing them to have a social skills lesson where they can talk about problems and understand that everyone battles life in different ways, and talk about their feelings and worries. Teaching our kids while still young will give them coping mechanisms to deal with different situations and teach them that bullying and discrimination is unacceptable and that not all illnesses/disabilities are visible.

attributes.action: Send all foreign prisoners back to their countries of origin and ban them.
attributes.background: We have seen on recent BBC news programmes that the UK prison service is in a dire straight. Lack of funding, violent and dangerous it is another failing part of the UK.  Foreign criminals, many from the EU now make up a significant part of the UK inmates and are costing us a fortune.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to walk a dog in a public place without a lead on
attributes.background: I am seeing a lot of dog attacks lately that could have been avoided if the dog was on a lead. I think it should be the law that all dogs are on a lead in a public place

attributes.action: More of the foreign aid budget should be funded towards WASH Projects globally.
attributes.background: Priti Patel, the Secretary of State for International Development said British aid money had previously been wasted and stolen. Funds as such could have been used towards Water And Sanitation Hygiene Projects; which would work towards the Global Goal 6, ensuring the availability of water to everyone
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government provide 0.7% of the Gross National Income to International aid. Most of this money is spent on educating children, immunisation, refugees and encouraging global action on climate change. However the water crisis is a significantly problematic issue, as 1 in 9 people do not have access to clean water and adequate sanitation, which kills 5,000 children daily.This leads to a lack of education and rapid spread of diseases, forcing families to fall further into extreme poverty.

attributes.action: Raise teachers' pay
attributes.background: Teachers are the backbone of society and there would be no future without them. Yet they so undervalued and undermined within society and do not receive a high enough wage.

attributes.action: Include same sex relationships as grounds for divorce under adultery
attributes.background: It seems absurd that a same sex couple can get married but if one of them should stray with a same sex person outside of the marriage adultery cannot be cited as grounds for divorce.
attributes.additional_details:
The same can be said for a traditional marriage where either partner has a relationship outside with a person the same sex as themselves, this isn't recognised as adultery.

This law should be overhauled to state that having sexual relations outside of marriage with any person is adultery.

attributes.action: Legalize Cannabis Oil and use it in the NHS to help people suffering from Cancer
attributes.background: Cannabis Oil itself is able to cure Cancer and there is enough evidence and research to prove so. if this was legalized and put into the NHS,the amount of patients suffering from cancer would decrease and would effectively save people from Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
also, the reason that cannabis oil (from cannabis) is not used to cure and kill cancer because it is a plant, and cannot be patented, which means pharmaceutical companies cannot make profit off it.

http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/government-finally-admits-cannabis-kills-6303176

https://www.cancertutor.com/index8/

http://www.cureyourowncancer.org/how-cannabis-oil-works.html

attributes.action: Amend Consumer Protection Act 1987 to include advice given by consumer experts
attributes.background: Advice given by travel consumer experts in the media is always minimal. So much information is omitted that if anyone follows the advice they may suffer financial losses. The CPA 1987 should be amended to force these experts to explain what risks are involved in following their suggestions.
attributes.additional_details:
E.g. - Ravi Rajani on ITV's Lorraine (11/8/16) 
He did not warn of the financial risk when booking travel separately. This is irresponsible coming so soon after the collapse of a holiday company with inadequate financial cover. A consumer champion should advise that the protection offered by the Package Travel, Package Holidays and Package Tours Regulations 1992 and Atol is far more important than saving pennies on the booking.

attributes.action: Have a referendum on term time leave from school for families, and not be fined
attributes.background: Many working families either cannot afford school holiday prices or parents cannot get time off work during the school holidays. Families feel that we are being penalised by being threatened with fines or prison and that children are missing out quality family time.
attributes.additional_details: By having this referendum it will give families hope that the government is listening to families and understand there frustrations, school is very important to a child's future but so is the opportunity of spending really quality time with there family once a year for a one week or two week break.

attributes.action: To make sure every care home has CCTV  to protect the elderly
attributes.background: After my grandmother was treated appallingly by home care staff in her own home and in care homes.
attributes.additional_details:
The police have cameras attached to them and I think carers should have the same kind of thing to stop the abuse of elderly people.
My gran died from blood poisoning caused by bed sores after carers did not provide adequate care

attributes.action: Stop the use of the honours system being used for political gain
attributes.background: All honours to be authorised only via an independent political free board. All members of the board must be free of any political party and any person who has held political office or served in a government department to be barred from holding office on this board
attributes.additional_details: Any person is permitted to put a person forward for any honour . In doing so they must state why they believe such person deserves this award.

attributes.action: Cross party review of Hinkley Point C costs, design risks and EDF's commitment.
attributes.background:
Hinkley Point C go-ahead is imminent.
Review needed of:
- construction costs,
- design risks (design known to be a problem / unproven),
- EDF's commitment to UK project given their own nuclear fleet needs refurbishment,
- agreed strike-price and top up by customers now power prices have fallen
attributes.additional_details:
http://stophinkley.org/StopPress.htm
https://secure.greenpeace.org.uk/page/s/osborne-dont-waste-billions-nuclear?source=em&subsource=20160307egem01&utm_source=gpeace&utm_medium=em&utm_campaign=20160307egem01

attributes.action: I'd like Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying to be recognised as an offense
attributes.background: Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying needs to be recognised as a crime. The victim is often left feeling helpless and controlled. Narcissists are sneaky and will attack while hiding behind others (to guard their reputation). Its a form of bullying which includes smear campaigns and 'gaslighting'
attributes.additional_details:
The definition of 'victim' is A person who is tricked or duped or A person who has come to feel helpless and passive in the face of misfortune or ill treatment.

Narcissists trick their victim, getting a thrill from manipulating them and making fools of them. If the victim retaliates, the narcissist will unleash a smear campaign, ruining that persons reputation. Its a form of covert bullying, which leaves lifes and careers in tatters. Narcissistic abuse can happen anywhere and is soul destroying

attributes.action: more support for parents with mental health, stop removing children
attributes.background: I have borderline personality disorder and because of a relapse and time in hospital, I had my children removed and placed in care. This was meant to be until I got better but they are still not home despite a return to good health and the children begging to be back. I am now fighting for them
attributes.additional_details: Too many children are removed based on a parent having mental health problems. I had mine taken despite social services saying I was a good mum and commending me on my parenting. All assessments have been positive but the psychological report paints a bad picture of people with mental health. How is removing children unless they were physically or sexually abused, benefitting children and their parents? More support in the home is needed for those that can be a good parent with help.

attributes.action: Ensure UK-EU Brexit deal retains our "passporting" rights in financial services
attributes.background: If we lose passporting rights in financial services due to Brexit it could be very damaging for the UK economy as firms re-locate activities to financial centres in the EU; this key issue has been largely ignored by politicians and this petition gives citizens a voice to help protect our economy

attributes.action: Early diagnosis for children with autism. Help afterwards.
attributes.background: 'Postcode' lottery for early diagnosis. No help once a diagnosis is made depending where you live.

attributes.action: Review and Change the Assesment process for PIP & ESA
attributes.background: Due to the unprecedented amount of Personal Independent Payment (PIP) and Employment Support Allowance (ESA) claims that are being overturned at Mandatory Reconsideration (MR) and Tribunal, we  demand that the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP), review and change the assessment system.
attributes.additional_details:
1.To stop using Atos/Capita assessors
2.All initial assessments to be carried out by the claimants local GP 
3.ALL assessors to be medically competent with the conditions they are assessing
4.ALL assessmentâ€™s to be recorded as a matter of course
6.Copies of all assessment reports to be sent to claimants 
7.Assessors to be penalised if reports untruthful
8.If a claimant goes through the process and awarded by the Court of Tribunal. The DWP should not withhold payment because of appeal.

attributes.action: Empty black bins once a week in summer and hot spells.
attributes.background: I, like many others suffer during the summer and sometimes other seasons  with fly and maggots in my black bin, even though I have it cleaned after every empty. I think the government should force councils to empty the black bins once a week during hot spells to reduce this.

attributes.action: Stay in the EU, enact Proportional Representation, and call a General Election
attributes.background:
Following the referendum on the UKâ€™s membership of the EU, we the undersigned call upon the British government to:

1. Reject the outcome of the referendum and formally state that the UK wishes to remain in the EU.

2. Enact Proportional Representation.

3. Call a General Election.

attributes.action: Require 75% turnout 60% majority for & 16+ voting in future   referendums
attributes.background: Less than 40% of UK Adults voted to for Brexit- a change that can't be reversed.  We must introduce a "triple lock" on future referendums about constitutional and irreversible changes.  The turn out must exceed 75%,  the majority in favour of change must exceed 60% and all those aged 16+ can vote

attributes.action: Establish London as an independent state so it can remain in the EU
attributes.background: Greater London voted overwhelmingly to remain. A disproportionate amount of our taxes goes to finance other regions in the UK & our economic wellbeing is severely threatened by a decision imposed upon us by others. We wish to cede from the UK & become an independent state within the EU.

attributes.action: UK Cities who voted "Remain" to be granted freedom to leave the UK & join the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum should never have happened.  The UK is a REPRESENTATIVE democracy ie we select and pay politicians to do the business of Government for us.  A decision so momentous should not have been handed to an electorate unqualified to comprehend the magnitude of the task.
attributes.additional_details:
The Referendum was about economics & trade. The media & certain politicians made it about blaming hard-working immigrants.

The EU Referendum was not supported by the educated or the young.  It was not supported by the cities.

London has a bigger GDP than many states. My city, Norwich, has thriving links with Europe as does Cambridge.  

We in the cities who voted to Remain in the EU see no alternative but to petition to be allowed to leave a country determined to commit economic suicide.

attributes.action: Introduce elections for selecting the UK Prime Minister
attributes.background:
An argument of the Brexit camp was that the EU does not reflect a democratic instutition. 

Standard practice is that the individual chosen to lead their political party is also the candidate for UK PM. The UK electorate should be able to cast a separate vote on who they feel should be PM.

attributes.action: Lower the Income Requirement for Spouse/Family Visas to UK from non EU Countries
attributes.background: The current income requirement for British citizens to bring their non-EU spouses to the UK is Â£18,600. According to the BBC, 50% of British Citizens do not earn enough to meet the new requirements. Britons earning minimum wage should have the right to a family. by basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
The High Courts suggested Â£13,000 ,above National Minimum Wage.Which, is being appealed by the Home Office as too low. Members of the EU with non-EU spouses aren't subjected to the same requirement. British citizens should not be punished for who they want to marry. 
The HS, Theresa May, said 'these current laws openly discriminate against the poor'.
Propose lowering the income requirement so that citizens working full-time(40 hours)on a minimum wage salary can be with their Spouses.

attributes.action: Have all religious institutions in the UK declare their source of funding.
attributes.background: In wake of the countless terror attacks occurring on European soil, the issue of radicalisation of people in the UK is an increasingly important issue. To help combat this issue all religious institutions should declare where they receive their funding and who the recipients of their charity are.
attributes.additional_details:
After sources revealing the situation in Germany regarding approximately 200 mosques offered to be built by the Saudi Government (one I find deplorable in how it acts), I feel that it is time to see where mosques in Great Britain get their funding from and where their charity goes and whether it goes to funding extremism or not.

This petition also applies to religious institutions of other faiths as this is more than possible.

attributes.action: Means test Maternity Pay reflecting women on leave who are 'the breadwinner'
attributes.background:
The current basic ruling on maternity pay is as follows :

Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) is paid for up to 39 weeks. You get:
- 90% of your average weekly earnings (before tax) for the first 6 weeks
- Â£139.58 or 90% of your average weekly earnings (whichever is lower) for the next 33 weeks
attributes.additional_details:
Information from:
https://www.gov.uk/maternity-pay-leave/pay

attributes.action: Families should only receive benefits & tax credits for their first two children
attributes.background: Why should people be having extensive families if they cannot afford them? Why should the hard-working tax-payer have to fork out for this? Why is there not a barrier on the amount of money provided for each family?
attributes.additional_details: On 7th June on the ITV programme, This Morning a lady was speaking about her 12 children & the Â£40,000 of benefits that she receives each year, not only this, but her plans for her 13th child. This, alongside many other stories like this one are becoming more regular. Should it be that people having 12 children gain more money through benefits than someone working full-time? There should be a point this is restricted and the choice to have more children is at the families own expense.

attributes.action: Not new grammar schools, put the funding into high achieving comprehensives.
attributes.background: In September, PM Theresa May announced the government's plans to reintroduce selective state education in the form of grammar schools. Students are selected by 11+ exams, not the age to be determining the schooling for the next 7 years. The government should prioritise existing comprehensives.
attributes.additional_details: The Government want these schools to be allowed to be created once again. This was not what was voted for in the 2015 Conservative manifesto, David Cameron was highly against grammar schools. The money should go to the success that is comprehensive schools. Studies have shown that comprehensive students have fared better at university and they achieve, even with non selection, competitive grades, why should the government try to separate students rather than fund comprehensive schooling more?

attributes.action: Require all local councils in England to use LED bulbs in street lights.
attributes.background: Sodium lighting is commonplace in British towns and cities. These orange lights cause a large amount of light pollution and make it difficult for most of us to see a full starry sky [1]. A switch to Amber LED lighting would improve these conditions greatly and would also be more energy efficient [2]
attributes.additional_details:
1. http://nightblight.cpre.org.uk/maps/ - The light pollution map for the UK 
2. http://www1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/publications/pdfs/alliances/outdoor_area_lighting.pdf - The American "Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy'"s report on new LED installation. 
- On the topic of Amber LED: In this case amber is the suggested colour as dimming the LEDs is the key in reducing light pollution emmisions, it also reduces blue-light exposure. http://darksky.org/lighting/led-practical-guide/

attributes.action: Allow rape victims to receive forensic examination and results before reporting
attributes.background: Potential rape victims often can't find out whether they have ingested a date rape drug unless they take legal action and report the crime. This involves undergoing a 3 hour forensic examination, making a video statement, and the arrest of the accused. They may also be forced to appear in court.
attributes.additional_details: Date rape drugs leave the system within 72 hours of being ingested, and forensic examinations should be made within this time frame too, so that the victim can eat, drink and shower normally. The decision to report is heavy, and should be given time. When forced to make a decision so quickly, victims are often pressured into reporting their crimes when it isn't in their interest to do so. Victims should have the right to receive the forensic examination and its results before reporting.

attributes.action: Preserve current opt-outs should the UK decide to rejoin the EU in the future.
attributes.background: The UK's recent vote to leave the EU saw young people vote overwhelmingly to remain, making it possible that future public opinion will favour rejoining. To make this process smoother we hereby call upon the government to preserve the UK's current opt-outs for potential future membership.
attributes.additional_details: Opt-outs are when EU Member States decide not to participate in European legislation or treaties. As a member since 1973, the UK opted out of both the Euro and the Schengen Agreement on passport-free movement of people. However, countries wishing to join in future may not opt out of such agreements permanently. Therefore, preserving current opt-outs for a future British application to rejoin the EU would make the terms of future membership more favourable.

attributes.action: Enforce harsher penalties for those who breach airports during protests
attributes.background: Recently, many "protesters" from environmental groups have been breaching airports and standing on runways. This is highly illegal, but they always leave with very small fines at worst.

attributes.action: Free childcare for parents who want to return to work , child is 4 months +
attributes.background: I think parents who want to return to work and can't afford childcare should have free childcare provided or help with at least 30 hours a week.
attributes.additional_details: Childcare can be expensive and many parents find working a full week only pays childcare fees, this leeds to many parents quitting jobs to try and save some money.

attributes.action: Restore incentives for community owned renewable onshore wind
attributes.background:
A recent report reveals more than two thirds of the public support renewable energy schemes where projects are undertaken at a community level and local people receive financial benefit.
We , the signatories of this petition call upon parliament to revisit support for on shore wind subsidies.
attributes.additional_details:
News story on Community Energy report :
http://www.theecologist.org/News/news_round_up/2988096/massive_support_for_community_renewable_energy.html

attributes.action: Change all road signs to display metric measurements in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In the UK, we have an outstanding problem. The continued mix-up of both metric and imperial measurements in our society confuses the great British people, especially to the younger generation. Completing the change to an easy and logical measuring system would be both inexpensive and simple.
attributes.additional_details: We buy our fuel for vehicles in litres, however the efficiency of cars is measured in "miles per gallon". Car manufacturers design the dimensions of cars in metric measurements however our roads signs display imperial. Old-fashioned measurements bring confusion to people from other societies and can lead to road accidents due to different measurement restrictions. Changing our road signage to display distance in metres and kilometres, vehicle restrictions in metres and speed given in kilometres per hour will help to end the in-consistency of measurements in the UK.

attributes.action: Help more young people and Adults with Autism into Employment.
attributes.background: I have a autistic spectrum condition and I have managed with support into gradual full time employment. Just because we have Autism doesn't make us incapable or means we can't work like any other person.

attributes.action: Government should not delay initiating secession because of Germans and French
attributes.background:
Delaying Article 50 because of German and French General Elections in 2017 is a political ruse on the part of Theresa May as the negotiations will not be affected by either result.

There is no reason why negotiations cannot start because a change will be to our advantage and make them easier.
attributes.additional_details:
At present, the two most formidable opponents of Britain in any post Brexit deal will be Merkel and Hollande.  That is the worst case scenario.

If Merkel is displaced, it will likely be by the election of candidates from the AfD.  If Hollande is displaced, it will likely be by the Front Nationale.  In both cases, they are highly Eurosceptical Parties and therefore unlikely to make it difficult for a British withdrawal. They are far more likely to give a good deal for us than at present.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for mental health especially in the young
attributes.background: Mental health services have been suffering with cuts year after year, until we are now ultimately in a 'mental health crisis', so many people are suffering and nothing is being done. Our government promised us more funding and we are yet to see the action. Mental health can affect everyone.

attributes.action: Benefits paid onto a government photo ID which limits what can be purchased.
attributes.background:
Sign this so that tax payers benefits are not spent on holidays, cigarettes, drugs, alcohol or sky TV etc.  
Benefits should not pay for luxuries or for people to go out socialisng and buying items working people consider luxury and difficult to afford.
attributes.additional_details:
People on benefits need support to live but they should not be able to spend this tax payers support on items working class people struggle to afford.  Shops would be limited in the items they can sell and prosecuted if they sell alcohol, cigarettes, lottery tickets, holidays etc. 
Pre-loaded cards should be in  the form of photo ID and a database to have the ability to store the bar codes of items purchased as a way for debt advisors to support budgeting if required.

attributes.action: We want to make a change to the government cuts towards disabled people.
attributes.background: NCS Wave 9 Black Country A Team Jackman are campaigning to help change the attitude of the government and where they place their money. They have cut back too much on the funding for the disabled and we want to make a change, this petition will help us make that difference that could change lives.
attributes.additional_details: We are working with our Patener charity Let Us Play, an organisation that works with disabled and vulnerable children from the ages 5-19. They do amazing work to help the children have a fun filled life. However they struggle to get the essentials that they need due to the government cuts towards disabled people for example, there used to be 27 rest bite beds in Wolverhampton alone and over the past few years it has reduced to 3. How unfair is that?

attributes.action: Acknowledge the loss of our friend Harambe, and issue a statement of regret
attributes.background: Harambe was a proud, benevolent, and majestic creature. Closely related to we humans, we should mourn the passing of this loving being appropriately. His death will not be in vain. He died as he lived, protecting the innocent, and showing us all how to live our own lives. An inspiration.
attributes.additional_details: Harambe was gunned down in cold blood, on May 28th 2016. He was just seventeen years old. Harambe was agitated by the crowd baying for his blood, even as Primatologist Jane Goodall opined that he was trying to protect the poor child involved (http://www.janegoodall.org/wp-content/uploads/2796_001.pdf).
